article.title: Herschel and SCUBA-2 observations of dust emission in a sample of Planck cold clumps

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following statements is **not** supported by Figure 1a?
choices: The median colour temperature increases when the analysis includes longer wavelengths.
The median spectral index increases when the analysis includes longer wavelengths.
Most colour temperature estimates are within 1K of the quoted median values.
There is a clear trend of increasing spectral index with increasing colour temperature.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Figure 2a indicate about the accuracy of the Planck CO estimates used to correct the continuum data?
choices: The Planck CO estimates are consistently underestimated by about 30%.
The Planck CO estimates are accurate to within approximately 30%.
The Planck CO estimates are consistently overestimated by about 30%.
There is no clear correlation between the Planck CO estimates and ground-based data.

multiple_choice_question.text: What general trend can be observed across the different panels of Figure 4 regarding the effect of including the 850 µm data point in the SED fits?
choices: Including the 850 µm data point generally increases the spectral index values.
Including the 850 µm data point has no significant effect on the spectral index values.
Including the 850 µm data point generally decreases the spectral index values.
The effect of including the 850 µm data point is inconsistent across different data reduction methods.

multiple_choice_question.text: According to Equation (1), what assumption is made about the dust emission to enable the estimation of clump masses (M)?
choices: The dust emission is optically thick.
Dust is characterized by a single temperature and a single β value.
The dust opacity per unit mass, κ(ν), is unknown.
